page.title: 13VILLAGE SCHOOL, ADLINGTON.
page.content: The school has 67 pupils from a large catchment area. It is situated by a road with fast traffic,several accidents involving parking of cars have occured so a lay-by is planned far 1986 making access safer. In 1985 school uniform was introduced,( going against a modern trend to abolish it.) with unanimous parental approval. Educational methods are traditional and modern, the result being similar to that of a large family with a balance of fun and discipline. Parents are actively involved in school-life helping with reading, crafts, sports and Brownies. Parents also play an important part in school government. Education here is a partnership between teachers, parents and pupils making a thriving village school.
